alert.note: Alert for Mariposa-Madera Lower Sierra; San Joaquin River Canyon; Upper San Joaquin River; Yosemite NP outside of the valley; Yosemite Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 20 at 6:52PM PST until February 23 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM MONDAY TO 4 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. Localized snow amounts of 9 to 12 inches will be possible in the highest elevations. Westerly winds will gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Mariposa-Madera Lower Sierra, Yosemite NP outside of the valley, Yosemite Valley, San Joaquin River Canyon and Upper San Joaquin River. * WHEN...From 4 PM Monday to 4 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Winds will also be gusty with gusts to 40 mph. Winds coupled with the cold temperatures will also create dangerous wind chills. Early season campers and hikers should be prepared for a return to winter conditions. Tree limbs and branches could be blown down and cause power outages.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Mariposa-Madera Lower Sierra; San Joaquin River Canyon; Upper San Joaquin River; Yosemite NP outside of the valley; Yosemite Valley
